data.X-Authentication-Warning: mercury.cacr.caltech.edu: majordomo set sender to owner-votable@us-vo.org using -f
data.Subject: Re: Any recommendations on development software?

body.plain:
Hi,

    We have a VOTable parser developed in C++
which is available at 
http://vo.iucaa.ernet.in/~voi/html/iucaawriteup.htm

Currently this has read-only facility, you cannot
write VOTables using this parser. We will soon
be adding the write facility and streaming support
for reading large VOTables.

- Thanks,
Sonali

-----------------------------------
Persistent Systems Private Limited      
Tel: +91-20-5678900 Ext. 328
-----------------------------------

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Stephen Lowe" <slowe@head-cfa.harvard.edu>
To: <votable@us-vo.org>; <metadata@us-vo.org>; <dm@us-vo.org>
Sent: Tuesday, November 05, 2002 7:47 PM
Subject: Any recommendations on development software?


> Hi all,
> 
> I was wondering if anyone has recommendations on development software
> for working with VOTables, XML Schema or FITS files. Particular areas
> we're interested in here are:
> 
> XML Binders --- the Caltech group used Breeze to create and distribute a
> Java class hierarchy (JAVOT) for manipulating VOTable data, reading and
> creating VOTable files. Are there features that recommend Breeze over
> alternatives, such as Sun's JAXB?
> 
> Are any of the participants working with a C++ binder and class library?
> 
> FITS file libraries --- we're trying the Java package nom.tam.fits. Any
> other suggestions?
> 
> Just to give some context, to support our demo system we're writing some
> translators to reformat FITS headers from several example archives into
> VOTables. We're presently using Java, nom.tam.fits and JAVOT, though
> we're early enough in development to change if we want. We're making
> some very provisional object definitions, such as a WCSXFORM object to
> encapsulate the pixel-to-sky coordinate transformation, so we may need
> to experiment with with modifications to the VOTable schema, which is
> why we're interested in the XML binder.
> 
> Thanks for any advice,
> Steve
> 
>

data.X-Authentication-Warning: mercury.cacr.caltech.edu: majordomo set sender to owner-votable@us-vo.org using -f
data.User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.0.1) Gecko/20020826
data.Subject: Re: Any recommendations on development software?

body.plain:
Stephen,

Stephen Lowe wrote:

>Hi all,
>
>I was wondering if anyone has recommendations on development software
>for working with VOTables, XML Schema or FITS files. Particular areas
>we're interested in here are:
>
>XML Binders --- the Caltech group used Breeze to create and distribute a
>Java class hierarchy (JAVOT) for manipulating VOTable data, reading and
>creating VOTable files. Are there features that recommend Breeze over
>alternatives, such as Sun's JAXB?
>  
>
As far as an automated way to go from XML to Java or C++ code, we have 
found that
you can only get a small headstart from these code writers, and 
sometimes they head you
in the wrong direction.  For extremely simple XML
you might get something useful and maybe VOTable is simple enough.  But 
for a real
data model (eg., the one Jonathan et al are developing),  it is unlikely 
that you can autogenerate useful
code either from XML or UML.  A few years from now, if MDA catches on 
maybe this will change.

As far as distribution, SUN's Open source JAXB is very easy to use. An 
xml file is stored
as a long string in an Oracle blob <--> java bean object <--> JSP pages.

>Are any of the participants working with a C++ binder and class library?
>
>FITS file libraries --- we're trying the Java package nom.tam.fits. Any
>other suggestions?
>  
>

Tom McGlynn's (tam) package appears to be very nice. We used it in our FITSML effort
(FITSML extends XDF) to create FITS to FITSML conversion. And it was quite straightforward
to couple JFITSIO with jXDF, so I imagine the same would be true with JAVOT.
There is also another Java FITSIO package by Ed Pier of GSFC/RITSS
at http://adfwww.gsfc.nasa.gov/swift/java_fits.tar.gz.
This package has its features, such as treating FITS BINTABLE as a Swing
JTable model. So once a file is read, the table data can be easily
displayed in a JTable.


>Thanks for any advice,
>Steve
>  
>
Ed & Shenping Huang

>  
>

data.X-Authentication-Warning: mercury.cacr.caltech.edu: majordomo set sender to owner-votable@us-vo.org using -f
data.Subject: Any recommendations on development software?

body.plain:
Hi all,

I was wondering if anyone has recommendations on development software
for working with VOTables, XML Schema or FITS files. Particular areas
we're interested in here are:

XML Binders --- the Caltech group used Breeze to create and distribute a
Java class hierarchy (JAVOT) for manipulating VOTable data, reading and
creating VOTable files. Are there features that recommend Breeze over
alternatives, such as Sun's JAXB?

Are any of the participants working with a C++ binder and class library?

FITS file libraries --- we're trying the Java package nom.tam.fits. Any
other suggestions?

Just to give some context, to support our demo system we're writing some
translators to reformat FITS headers from several example archives into
VOTables. We're presently using Java, nom.tam.fits and JAVOT, though
we're early enough in development to change if we want. We're making
some very provisional object definitions, such as a WCSXFORM object to
encapsulate the pixel-to-sky coordinate transformation, so we may need
to experiment with with modifications to the VOTable schema, which is
why we're interested in the XML binder.

Thanks for any advice,
Steve

data.Received:
by exchange01.rl.ac.uk with Internet Mail Service (5.5.2656.59)
	id <YDP9SXXA>; Mon, 9 Dec 2002 23:53:38 -0000
data.X-Authentication-Warning: mercury.cacr.caltech.edu: majordomo set sender to owner-votable@us-vo.org using -f
data.Subject: TreeView tool - including VOTable support

body.plain:
Hi

we have released a new tool whch allows one to browse structured data. It
has recently been enhanced by adding VOTable support.

The VOTable capabilities includes support of STREAM data - for example
pointing to an external FITS file. 

We are beginning to support this tool on MSWindows, in addition to the more
usual Linux, Solaris and Tru64.

The tools can be found at http://www.starlink.ac.uk/treeview

We will be tidying up the VOtable access library in the coming weeks.

Hope this is of interest. We are improving the tool rapidly so please keep
an eye on the web site. Please let me know if you have any problems.

...David
